result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew M Slamka was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber privileges for work and treatment.  Good time to apply.

miscConds.notes: $745.00 payable to BMO Harris Bank, converted to civil judgment with tax intercept. Bail to be applied if applicable.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees while on probation or civil judgment will be entered.

Defendant advised that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; also advised that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew M Slamka

records.addlTxt:
THE COURT FINDS, ORDERS AND ADJUDGES:
1.)	Restitution.  Judgment is GRANTED against the Defendant in favor of the victim(s) for the amount unpaid.
2.)	Court costs.  Judgment is GRANTED against the Defendant for unpaid court ordered financial obligation in the amount of $602.52.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Filed, sdg.
records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Andrew M Slamka in court with attorney Debra Jeanne Patterson.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.

Defendant sentenced to serve SIX (6) MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for ZERO (0) DAYS time served.  Huber privileges for work and treatment.  GOOD TIME TO APPLY.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of FIFTEEN (15) MONTHS/YEARS.  CONCURRENT TO 14CF5160.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Obtain and maintain employment.
* Restitution payable to BMO HARRIS BANK for SEVEN HUNDRED AND FORTY-FIVE DOLLARS ($745.00) CONVERTED to civil judgment WITH tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees WHILE ON PROBATION or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH tax intercept.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit.
(1).  On behalf of Defendant.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Andrew M Slamka in court with attorney Debra Jeanne Patterson.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

DTC - PHASE IV

The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance and State's motion, the court revoked the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Br. 33.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 12, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Andrew M Slamka in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Previous plea is vacated.  The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract.
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months to 18 months.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.  Review hearing scheduled for February 20, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.
